vision.title: HELP YOU LEARN HOW TO INTEGRATE AI INTO YOUR BUSINESS &REACH 10-100X RETURN

col_1.title: Better quality of product and service
col_1.content: Utilize AI to increase business productivity, better quality and increasingly personalized AI-enhanced products.

col_2.title: Competitive advantage with AI
col_2.content: Provide the companies with AI capability as a competitive advantage to make it harder to copycat.

col_3.title: 10-100x Transformation
col_3.content: Unlock the companies’ scalability bottleneck with  AI instead of manual / human approach

col_1.title: 01 _ Limited understanding on How to apply AI in solving busines problem
col_1.content: Blind spot of how AI can and can’t help unlock certain bottlenecks that startups are facing. How AI can be relevant in their business model. Or limited understanding what technology is easiest to start with or easy to use & what the state-of-the-art AI approaches are.

col_2.title: 02 _ HOW TO IMPLEMENT AI INFRASTRUCTURE (MLOPS)
col_2.content: AI infrastructure (or MLOPS) - or how to integrate AI prototypes into their business - is one of the most common roadblocks of any technology company in Vietnam. How to access and manage the computing resources to test, train and deploy AI algorithms?

col_3.title: 03 _ HOW TO BUILD DATA PIPELINE
col_3.content: Data pipeline architecture could be a tricky task. How far is it from Manual → Semi-automatic → Automatic?

why_we.title: Why we are in unique position to offer this bootcamp

col_1.title: Global AI Network
col_1.content: Utilize AI to increase business productivity, better quality and increasingly personalized AI-enhanced products.

col_2.title: Customizable AI Assessment
col_2.content: Ability to tailor our AI evaluation to each company joining the bootcamp.

col_3.title: Proven AI Programs
col_3.content: Experience & expertise in providing AI training from foundational to advanced levels.

mentors.name: Thang Luong
mentors.title: Senior Research Scientist at Google Brain; VietAI
mentors.description:
Thang Luong is currently a senior research scientist at Google Brain. Having published over 30 scientific articles at premier conferences with over 5000 citations, Dr. Luong is a well-known AI researcher in the field of deep learning and machine learning. He has authored many patents and open-source software used worldwide.

Dr. Luong obtained his PhD in Computer Science from Stanford University in 2016. He also co-founded VietAI, a non-profit organization that aims to build a community of world-class AI experts in Vietnam.

mentors.name: Thuc Vu
mentors.title: OhmniLab, Kambria Foundation
mentors.description: Thuc Vu holds a PhD in Computer Science from Stanford University. He is a serial entrepreneur and social entrepreneur. His ventures include co-founding Tappy, a hyperlocal social app that has been acquired by Weeby.co,. and Katango, a social app, acquired by Google. He is also a co-founder of VietSeed, a nonprofit organization that helps underprivileged students in Vietnam obtain a college education. Thuc Vu is a prominent figure in the Vietnamese tech startup ecosystem and is often seen as the connector between Vietnamese and Silicon Valley players.

mentors.name: Vu Van
mentors.title: ELSA Speak
mentors.description: Co-founder/CEO of ELSA, Corp. MBA & M.Ed @ Stanford; Hard-core operator & tireless entrepreneur. Passion in edtech and how we can use technology to change the education landscape, and make education accessible to all & at high quality.

groups.title: AI Advisor
groups.description: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, conetur sadipscing elitr, sed diam nonumy

mentors.name: Truyen Tran
mentors.title: Associate Professor, Deakin University, Australia
mentors.description:
Dr. Truyen Tran is Associate Professor of Artificial Intelligence at Deakin University, Australia. His ultimate research goals are uncovering the nature of intelligence to design competent and human-friendly intelligent machines, and transform living, physical and digital fields through AI.

Together with his team, Dr. Truyen has made advances in multiple research areas including deep neural networks, visual reasoning, machine learning for biomedicine, materials science, recommender system and software analytics.

Currently he is building machines that can remember and reason about what they see, while being mindful of what others think, and respect human values.

Tran holds a Bachelor of Science from the University of Melbourne in 2001 and a PhD in Computer Science from Curtin University in 2008. Before working at Deakin University, he spent a year in the industry, and 3 years as a postdoc at Curtin University.

mentors.name: Preslav Nakov
mentors.title: Principal Scientist, Qatar Computing Research Institute
mentors.description:
Dr. Preslav Nakov is a Principal Scientist at the Qatar Computing Research Institute (QCRI), HBKU. His research interests include computational linguistics, 'fake news' detection, fact-checking, machine translation, question answering, sentiment analysis, lexical semantics, Web as a corpus, and biomedical text processing.

At QCRI, he leads the Tanbih project, developed in collaboration with MIT, which aims to limit the effect of 'fake news', propaganda and media bias by making users aware of what they are reading.

Dr. Nakov is the Secretary of ACL SIGLEX and ACL SIGSLAV, and a member of the EACL advisory board. He also serves on the editorial boards of the Journal of Transactions of the Association for Computational Linguistics, Computer Speech and Language, Natural Language Engineering, AI Communications, and Frontiers in AI. He is also on the Editorial Board of the Language Science Press Book Series on Phraseology and Multiword Expressions.

Dr. Nakov received his PhD from the University of California at Berkeley (supported by a Fulbright grant). He is the recipient of the Bulgarian President's John Atanasoff award, named after the inventor of the first automatic electronic digital computer.

mentors.name: Huyen Chip
mentors.title: Senior Deep Learning Engineer, NVIDIA
mentors.description:
Chip Huyen is a writer and computer scientist based in Silicon Valley. She graduated with a BS and MS in Computer Science from Stanford University, where she created and taught the course TensorFlow for Deep Learning Research. In her current role as senior deep learning engineer at NVIDIA, she works on productizing AI research at NVIDIA.

When not teaching machines to understand human languages, she writes books and blog. She’s the author of the best-selling series 'Xách ba lô lên và Đi', 'Giấc mơ Mỹ - Đường đến Stanford', and 'Tuổi trẻ không hối tiếc'. Her writings have also been published in reputable media outlets in the USA, France, and Vietnam.

mentors.name: Bach Bui
mentors.title: Head of Engineer, AMAZON
mentors.description: Bach Bui is the Head of Engineer at Alexa Deep Learning Inference group, where he is leading a team of engineers and applied scientists building the next generation voice assistant system. Before that he was a co-founder of Arimo, a start-up founded in Silicon Valley. Bach got his PhD in Computer Science from University Illinois, Urbana Champaign. He has more than 15 years of experience running engineering and product teams building cutting edge Big Data and AI products in both startup and big company environments. He has authored over 6 patents and 12 scientific publications.

mentors.name: Christopher Cuong T. Nguyen
mentors.title: President of Arimo & Governing Board of Fulbright University Vietnam
mentors.description:
Christopher Cuong T. Nguyen is President and CEO of Arimo, a Panasonic company in Silicon Valley, where he leads the development of AI platforms and solutions for the enterprise.

He has served as engineering director of Google Apps and co-founded two other successful startups. As a professor, Christopher co-founded the Computer Engineering program at HKUST.

He earned his B.S. degree from the University of California-Berkeley summa cum laude, and a PhD. From Stanford, where he created the first standard-encoding Vietnamese software suite, authored RFC 1456 and contributed to Unicode 1.1.

Source: Fulbright University

mentors.name: Ph.D Xavier Anguera
mentors.title: CTO, ELSA Corp
mentors.description: Xavier Anguera is the Co-Founder and CTO of ELSA Corp. Within Elsa he is responsible for engineering, research in speech/AI and data science. Prior to Elsa, he founded a digital electronic/audio-books publisher aimed at helping language learners getting used to the language while reading.

mentors.name: Ph.D Hung Tran
mentors.title: Founder/CEO Got It & Steam for Vietnam
mentors.description: Hung Tran finished his Phd in Computer Science at University of Iowa, where he served as Assistant Professors in undergrad and grad courses at the Department of Computer Science. As a scientist with astute business sense, Dr Tran took on his entrepreneurship with passion in leveraging AI Technologies for Education and Knowledge Sharing. He founded and is currently the CTO of Got It, Inc., aiming to build the world's first No Code, Conversational AI Interface to any Database and Steam for Vietnam, a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization to bring world-class STEAM education to the Vietnamese people for free.

mentors.name: Ph.D Steven Truong
mentors.title: CEO, VinBrain
mentors.description:
Mr. Truong has over 25 years of experience in the software industry as an engineer and a strategic leader. Prior to joining VinGroup, he had been a senior leader at Microsoft since 2007. He has experience leading teams to improve enterprise productivity and customer value, bringing the best of technologies together to make a bigger business impact.

He is passionate about creating new ventures, innovating product lines and services, and building motivated teams to lead them to wonderful accomplishments.

mentors.name: Jared Go
mentors.title: CTO, Ohmnilabs & Kambria
mentors.description:
Jared Go is the Co-Founder and Chief Technology Officer at OhmniLabs. An entrepreneur who loves bringing together research, engineering, and design to solve real-world problems, Jared is passionate about making robots that can be truly useful in people’s homes and lives. An avid maker and roboticist, he experimented with generations of robot designs to help him better connect with his family on the opposite coast of the US.

Previously, Jared was the CTO and founding team member at Hobnob where he developed patented network algorithms and hardware to make cellular networks faster and more reliable. He is an expert with decades of experience in algorithms, software development, and computer graphics. His broad experience also covers mechanical and electrical engineering, as well as industrial design. Jared is a former Stanford PhD student and Stanford Graduate Fellow. He holds a degree in Computer Science from Carnegie Mellon.

mentors.name: Hung Bui
mentors.title: Director, VinAI Research, VinGroup
mentors.description:
Dr. Hung H. Bui is the Director of VinAI Research, VinGroup, Vietnam. His technical expertise and interests include probabilistic graphical models, deep generative models, Bayesian inference and machine learning, especially models for sequential and relational data with applications in human activity/intent recognition, video understanding and natural language processing. These interests center around the challenging problem of how to make the machine better understand the humans - a problem that plays a central part in intelligent assistive technologies, personal assistance and dialogue management.

Before joining VinAI, he was at Google DeepMind, Adobe Research and Nuance Natural Language Understanding Lab. He also spent almost 10 years at the AI Center, SRI International (formerly Stanford Research Institute), where he led the multi-institution research team in developing probabilistic inference technologies for understanding the user activities during the CALO project (at the time, the largest AI project in history, also known as the project that spun off Siri).

Dr. Hung received his Ph.D. in Computer Science from Curtin University in 1998, and spent three years as an assistant professor at the university.

groups.title: AI Expert Buddy
groups.description: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, conetur sadipscing elitr, sed diam nonumy

mentors.name: Thang Nguyen
mentors.title: Director, Saigon-Hanoi Bank
mentors.description:
Thang Nguyen graduated with a master's degree from the Hanoi Open University and is currently Deputy Director of Development Center at Saigon-Hanoi Bank.

He is also the founder of Mi AI Blog, a community of nearly 20K members sharing about AI in the style of 'Mi an lien' (instant noodles) through real projects.

mentors.name: Ba Ngoc
mentors.title: Founder of ProtonX; Google Developer Expert in Machine Learning
mentors.description: Ba Ngoc is the Founder of ProtonX and VietAI Hanoi. He loves programming and machine learning and strongly believes that “Machines are capable of getting past the limits of human speed in the future”. He won Singapore UNESCO Open Data and Science Hackathon 2018. Besides, he has been writing a blog named “Learn machine learning in two months” and earned more than 1400 stars on Github. At VietAI, he's enthusiastic about teaching students Logistic Regression and Neural Network. In 2019, Ngoc was recognized by Google as the first Google Developer Expert in Machine Learning in Vietnam. In 2020, he has trained 31 applicants who passed the Tensorflow exam and became Tensorflow Certificate Holders.

mentors.name: Ngan Nguyen
mentors.title: Natural Language Processing (NLP) Engineer
mentors.description:
Ngân is a Natural Language Processing (NLP) Engineer. She graduated from University of Engineering and Technology-VNU with a BSc in Computer Science in the Honors Program. Her interest lies in computational linguistics research which includes syntactic and semantic parsing techniques and NLP applications such as information extraction, virtual assistant, etc.

She is currently working in fake news detection project.

mentors.name: Thai Dinh
mentors.title: Director, Data Science, VISA
mentors.description: Thai Dinh holds a Master degree from the University of Wisconsin-Madison, where his research focused on Optimization under uncertainty and Optimization-based Machine Learning methods. He has authored/co-authored papers on top-tier scientific journals such as Mathematical Programming and Nature Energy. Thai has spent time doing research at some of the largest national laboratories in the US, including Argonne and NREL. Thai is currently a Data Scientist at Trusting Social, where he is also in charge of a Data Science training program for junior members of the team.

mentors.name: Brian Vũ
mentors.title: Head of data - Cofounder @ Primedata.ai
mentors.description: Experienced in combining Deep Science with Exceptional Engineering to develop Platform that address these difficult Mar-Tech problems in Digital product companies.

processes.title: Registration
processes.description:
Click{' '} APPLY{' '} to fill the registration form. In this form, we expect to learn more about your company, milestones, & primary roadblocks in terms of applying AI to your business model. Please respond carefully at your best effort. To achieve great outcomes, we expect at least two members (1 business & 1 tech lead/executive) per company to enroll in our program.

For us to fully evaluate the company's potential, we expect to get detailed answers jointly by the CEO (for business) and CTO (for tech). Only 1 submission per company.

processes.title: Screening
processes.description: Initial evaluation of candidates and their businesses. Selected companies will be invited to the next round - Interview.

processes.title: Interview
processes.description: Your interview will be scheduled into one of the following days: June 18, 19, 25, 26 (10AM - 11:30AM)

processes.title: Final companies confirmed
processes.description: Congratulations! The very first batch of AI Bootcamp for Startups will be confirmed via email.

questions.question: What is pre-requisite criteria for the first batch?
questions.answer:
1. Potential to apply AI to reach 10-100x returns.
  2. Executive willingness & tech team qualification. (Are you excited about learning to apply AI?
  3. Can they execute what we advise in the next 6 months? Post-launch companies

questions.question: How to apply?
questions.answer: Click here for the whole selection process review or click here to apply

questions.question: Can we get funding (scholarship) for this AI Bootcamp?
questions.answer: Yes. We offer conditional scholarships for outstanding startups, especially for social enterprises. Please check it out to see if you meet the criteria.

questions.question: How long does the AI Bootcamp take?
questions.answer: 12 intensive weeks. You have to spend at least 3 full weekdays for 8 middle weeks of intensive training. The other 2 weeks will be for one-on-one mentoring and final 2 weeks for prototype & demo showcase.
